item.title: Is Code Review Always A Good Thing?
item.description: Code review is one of those hygienic things most developers believe they ought to do, like kitchen workers washing their hands, but don’t always do. Yet tech articles tend to be unanimously in favor of code review, extolling its benefits (“catch bugs”, “maintain code consistency”, “transfer knowledge”). So if restaurants can require workers to wash their hands, maybe organizations can require their developers to review every code change? Broadly speaking I think we can lump all of code review’s benefits under the category of “improve code quality”.
